description: Confluent Open Source Grafana Dashboard v5.2.3

panels.description: Average number of outgoing/incoming bytes per second. As with Kafka brokers, you will want to monitor your producer network throughput. Observing traffic volume over time is essential for determining whether you need to make changes to your network infrastructure. Monitoring producer network traffic will help to inform decisions on infrastructure changes, as well as to provide a window into the production rate of producers and identify sources of excessive traffic.
panels.title: Producer OutGoing Bytes

panels.description: The average request latency in ms. The average request latency is a measure of the amount of time between when KafkaProducer.send() was called until the producer receives a response from the broker.
panels.title: Producer Request Latency Avg

panels.description: The  amount  of  time  the  request  spends  in  queue  after  it  has  been  received  but before processing starts.
panels.title: Producer Record Queue Time Avg

panels.description: The average compression rate of record batches.
panels.title: Kafka Producer Compression Rate Avg

panels.description: The request rate is the rate at which producers send data to brokers.
panels.title: Producer Request Rate

panels.description: For producers, the response rate represents the rate of responses (per second) received from brokers.
panels.title: Producer Response Rate

panels.description: Average length of time the I/O thread spent waiting for a socket (in ns)
panels.title: Producer I/O Wait Time
